Article.Abstract: A universal influenza virus vaccine that does not require frequent updates and/or annual immunizations will offer significant advantages over current seasonal flu vaccines. The highly conserved influenza virus A M2 membrane protein has been previously suggested as a potential antigen target for such a vaccine. Here, we report systematic evaluation of M2 peptide conjugate vaccines (synthetic peptides of M2 extracellular domain conjugated to keyhole limpet hemocyanin (KLH) or Neisseria meningitidis outer membrane protein complex (OMPC)) in mice, ferrets, and rhesus monkeys. The conjugate vaccines were highly immunogenic in all species tested and were able to confer both protection against lethal challenge of either H1N1 or H3N1 virus in mice and reduce viral shedding in the lower respiratory tracts of mice and ferrets. The protection against lethal challenge in mice could also be achieved by passive transfer of monkey sera containing high M2 antibody titers. In addition, we showed that M2 antisera were cross reactive with M2 peptides derived from a wide range of human influenza A strains, but they failed to react with M2 peptides of the pathogenic H5N1 virus (A/Hong Kong/97). The data presented here will permit better understanding of the potential of an M2-based vaccine approach.
Article.ArticleTitle: Preclinical study of influenza virus A M2 peptide conjugate vaccines in mice, ferrets, and rhesus monkeys.
Article.Affiliations: Department of Vaccine and Biologics Research, Merck Research Laboratories, 770 Sumneytown Pike, P.O. Box 4, WP16-306, West Point, PA 19486, USA.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 20 µg, administered at intervals of 2 weeks.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A cysteine residue was added to C-terminus of A/Aichi/68-M2 peptide (MSLLTEVETPIRNEWGCRCNDSSD) for conjugation purpose.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Sera from mice immunized with A/Aichi/68-M2 (MSLLTEVETPIRNEWGCRCNDSSD)-KLH cross-reacted to the epitope.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 20 µg, administered at intervals of 2 weeks.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A cysteine residue was added to C-terminus of the epitope for conjugation purpose.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Sera from the epitope immunized mice cross reacted to Influenza A/Aichi/470/68 M2 protein fragment (1-24).

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 20 µg, administered at intervals of 2 weeks.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A cysteine residue was added to C-terminus of the epitope for conjugation purpose.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Sera from the epitope immunized mice did not cross react to A/Hong Kong/156/97 (H5N1) Matrix protein 2 peptide (1-24).

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 20 µg, administered at intervals of 2 weeks.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A cysteine residue was added to C-terminus of the epitope for conjugation purpose.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Sera from the epitope immunized mice did not cross react to A/Chicken/New York/95 (H7N2) Matrix protein 2 peptide (1-24).

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 20 µg, administered at intervals of 2 weeks.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A cysteine residue was added to C-terminus of the epitope for conjugation purpose.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A cysteine residue was added to C-terminus of the epitope for conjugation purpose.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Sera from the epitope immunized mice cross reacted to Influenza A/Hebei/95 M2 protein fragment (1-24).

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 20 µg, administered at intervals of 2 weeks.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A cysteine residue was added to C-terminus of the epitope for conjugation purpose.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Sera from the epitope immunized mice cross reacted to Influenza A/A/Wisconsin/3523/88 M2 protein fragment (MSLLTEVETPIRNEWGCKCNDSSD).

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 20 µg, administered at intervals of 2 weeks.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A cysteine residue was added to C-terminus of A/PR/34 peptide (MSLLTEVETPIRNEWGCRCNGSSD) for conjugation purpose.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Sera from mice immunized with A/PR/34 peptide (MSLLTEVETPIRNEWGCRCNGSSD)-KLH cross-reacted to the epitope.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 20 µg, administered at intervals of 2 weeks.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A cysteine residue was added to C-terminus of the epitope for conjugation purpose.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Sera from the epitope immunized mice cross reacted to Influenza A/Hebei/95 M2 protein fragment (1-24).

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 10, 30, 100, or 300 µg, administered at weeks 0, 8 and 25.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A cysteine residue was added to C- terminus of the epitope for conjugation. Neisseria meningitidis outer membrane protein complex (OMPC) was conjugated to the epitope at C- terminus of the epitope. Half of the groups of monkeys were preimmunized with a commercial vaccine (PedVax) to generated immunity against the carrier for control.

AdoptiveTransfer.AdoptiveTransferComments: Sera from monkeys immunized with the epitope-OMPC conjugate was adoptively transferred into mice recipients.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Adoptive transfer of sera from monkeys immunized with the epitope-OMPC conjugate formulated in Alum plus QS21 protected mice from infection with HKxPR8 (H3N1) virus. But the sera from monkey immunized with the vaccine formulated in Alum lacked the protection, which was reflective of the relatively lower antibody titers in these sera.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 20 µg, administered at intervals of 2 weeks.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A cysteine residue was added to C-terminus of the epitope for conjugation purpose.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Sera from the epitope immunized mice did not cross react to A/Hong Kong/156/97 (H5N1) Matrix protein 2 peptide (1-24).

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 20 µg, administered at intervals of 2 weeks.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A cysteine residue was added to C-terminus of the epitope for conjugation purpose.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Sera from the epitope immunized mice did not cross react to A/Chicken/New York/95 (H7N2) Matrix protein 2 peptide (1-24).

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Administration in vivo to prevent or reduce disease
FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 100 µg, administered at intervals of 4 weeks.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A cysteine residue was added to either N- or C- terminus of the epitope for conjugation. Keyhole limpet hemocyanin (KLH) or Neisseria meningitidis outer membrane protein complex (OMPC) was conjugated to the epitope at either N- or C- terminus of the epitope.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope conjugated vaccines protected ferrets from infection with H1N1 virus as measured by reducing viral shedding in the lower respiratory tracts (lung), but there was no apparent difference in terms of rate of nasal shedding and viral titers between the epitope conjugate vaccinated and control groups.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Administration in vivo to prevent or reduce disease
FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 20 µg, administered at intervals of 2 weeks.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope conjugated to KLH protected mice from infection with PR8 virus as measured by weight change and mortality.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Administration in vivo to prevent or reduce disease
FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 20 µg, administered at intervals of 2 weeks.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were immunized with either Aichi-M2-KLH vaccine plus complete Freund’s and incomplete Freund’s adjuvant or Aichi-M2-KLH vaccine plus QS21 adjuvant.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope conjugated to KLH protected mice from infection with HKxPR8(H3N1) as measured by weight change, mortality, nasal and lung wash viral titers at the respective time points (at day 1, 3, 5, 7 and 9 after HKxPR8 virus challenge).

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 20 µg, administered at intervals of 2 weeks.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A cysteine residue was added to C-terminus of the epitope for conjugation purpose.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Sera from the epitope immunized mice cross reacted to Influenza A/A/Wisconsin/3523/88 M2 protein fragment (MSLLTEVETPIRNEWGCKCNDSSD).

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 100 µg, administered at intervals of 4 weeks.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A cysteine residue was added to either N- or C- terminus of the epitope for conjugation. Keyhole limpet hemocyanin (KLH) or Neisseria meningitidis outer membrane protein complex (OMPC) was conjugated to the epitope at either N- or C- terminus of the epitope.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Among the four different vaccines, C-terminal conjugates with either KLH or OMPC carrier elicited higher titers than their N-terminal counterparts, and conjugates prepared with OMPC carrier elicited higher titers than those with KLH carrier. The epitope covalently coupled through the C-terminus to OMPC (M2-OMPC) represented the most immunogenic form among the four conjugates tested.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 20 µg, administered at intervals of 2 weeks.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A cysteine residue was added to C-terminus of the epitope for conjugation purpose.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Sera from the epitope immunized mice cross reacted to Influenza A/Puerto Rico/8/34 M2 protein fragment (1-24).

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 10, 30, 100, or 300 µg, administered at weeks 0, 8 and 25.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A cysteine residue was added to C- terminus of the epitope for conjugation. Neisseria meningitidis outer membrane protein complex (OMPC) was conjugated to the epitope at C- terminus of the epitope. Half of the groups of monkeys were preimmunized with a commercial vaccine (PedVax) to generated immunity against the carrier for control.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope-OMPC conjugate vaccine elicited significant epitope-specific titers after a single immunization. These responses were further boosted after second and third immunizations. There was no apparent dose effect on both OMPC-immunized and OMPC-naive monkeys. The conjugates formulated in Alum plus QS21 showed 5- to 10-fold higher antibody titers than the average titers elicited by the same dose of the conjugate formulated in Alum alone.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 20 µg, administered at intervals of 2 weeks.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A cysteine residue was added to C-terminus of the epitope for conjugation purpose.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 20 µg, administered at intervals of 2 weeks.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A cysteine residue was added to C-terminus of the epitope for conjugation purpose.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Sera from mice immunized with PR8-M2 peptide (fragment 1-24) cross reacted to the epitope by ELISA.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A cysteine residue was added to C-terminus of the epitope for conjugation purpose.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Sera from mice immunized with Aichi influenza virus M2 peptide (fragment 1-24) cross reacted to the epitope by ELISA.
